subject: Re: [junit] Running suites with annotation
msgSnippet: new JUnitCore().run(class1); Hope this helps, David Saff
messageBody:
new JUnitCore().run(class1);

Hope this helps,

David Saff

On Thu, Apr 8, 2010 at 6:23 PM, daddytli <thomasyli@...> wrote:
> With "older" traditional creation of test suites, the suite() method is used. I can invoke the test via
> Method method = class1.getMethod( "suite", new Class[0] );
> obj1 = (Test) method.invoke( null, new Class[0] );
> obj1.run(testresult);
>
> How can I invoke classes which have the newer annotation style @...(...) defined?
>
> Tom
